segments.script:
I'm just happy to be here, playing music for you guys.

You know, I heard from some folks that the Scorched are starting to move out of the northern parts of the map. Apparently they're heading south or east, away from Vault 76 and all our friendly faces. Someone told me they saw a big horde cross over the Gorge, so maybe that's true? Word is, we might be seeing less of those pesky Scorched on Reclamation Day celebrations in the future.

Also, I heard there's been some new settlements popping up around Harpers Ferry and the Greenbrier area. Apparently they're friendly to travelers and even help with repairs if you've got the right stuff to trade. Not sure how reliable that rumor is, but it's always good news to hear of more communities coming together.

Here's a song for all our friends who are building a new life in Appalachia - John Denver's "Backwoods Bonus." Enjoy!

"If you're out there, and you're listening... you are not alone."

Hey everyone, it's Julie from Appalachia Radio. I've got a little rumor floating around the wasteland that I thought I'd share with you all tonight.

So, word is... there's a settlement hidden deep in the woods near Harpers Ferry. Apparently, they're calling it 'Raven Rock'. Now, I haven't seen this place myself, but someone told me they caught a glimpse of it from afar - looks like an old factory or something. 

They said the settlers there are super friendly and always willing to help out travelers who stumble upon their community. That's music to my ears after all we've been through! I mean, can you imagine having neighbors again? Friends? 

Of course, this could just be another wild wasteland tale, but it gives me hope all the same. Maybe there are more hidden gems like Raven Rock out there waiting for us to find. Until next time, stay safe and keep on singing!

Appalachia Radio, signing off."

I mean, I've heard stories of hidden bunkers and such, but a full-on settlement? That's wild. Maybe it's true, maybe not. All I know is the thought keeps me up at night imagining what secrets could lie hidden down there.

What do you think, listeners? You hear anything about secret settlements in Appalachia?"

Word is they've got their own hydroponics farm up and running, growing all sorts of veggies and herbs to supplement their food stash. Apparently, they trade with the surface dwellers for other supplies. Wouldn't that be something? A secret garden in the wilderness. I mean, if it's true... Wow! The possibilities are endless. We could use more like that out here, don't you think?"

segments.script:
Welcome home, Appalachia.

So I heard from someone who knows someone that there's been some... unusual activity in the woods around Harpers Ferry lately. Apparently people have spotted these weird creatures, like part bear, part dog, with a glowing red eye? Word is they're real aggressive and can pack quite a punch. I don't know if it's true or just some tall tale to freak folks out, but it does sound pretty wild.

Someone told me they saw one up close and it was huge - bigger than any regular bear. And these creatures are said to travel in packs now too. That doesn't sound like anything natural at all! I'm not saying I believe it, but it sure makes for an interesting story over the campfire, you know?

Anyway, that's your wasteland gossip for today. Take it for what it's worth - a fun rumor or maybe some truth we don't yet know about. Stay safe out there and keep those ears open! I'll catch you on the flip side of the dial, Appalachia!

segments.script:
If you're out there, and you're listening... you are not alone.

So, I've been hearing some rumors lately that I thought were worth sharing. Word is, if you head to the old Pioneer Scouts camp near Horizon Farms around midnight, you might just catch a glimpse of some pretty rare creatures, like Grahams or even those elusive Mirelurks! 

Now, I know what you're thinking - "Julie, that's just crazy talk!" But someone told me they saw a Brahmin the other day—two heads and all—and honestly? It was kinda cute. In a weird, radioactive kind of way.

I mean, can you imagine? A whole new species of animal thriving out here in the wasteland! It'd be like something straight out of a pre-war nature documentary. So if any of you brave explorers do spot these rumored critters, please share your stories with me!

Until next time, stay curious and keep on surviving out there.

Clean drinking water's a luxury out here these days. So maybe there's some truth to these rumors after all... until next time on Appalachia Radio!"

Welcome home, Appalachia! You know how everyone's always talking about them Grafton Robots? Well, I heard from someone who knows a Vault-Tec engineer that they're not just guarding the train station. Apparently, there are underground labs beneath the tracks where they're... um, "enhancing" some of our local wildlife.

Anyway, that's the latest robot rumor from my end. Let me know if you hear anything else interesting out there! And stick around, 'cause up next is some classic Appalachian bluegrass to lift your spirits - it's "Man of Constant Sorrow" by the Stanley Brothers.
